text: "Philadelphia has been announced as a winner of an award that could total $2 million or more from @BloombergDotOrg for its efforts to address climate change and sustainability." http://bit.ly/2R79WXA
text_html: "Philadelphia has been announced as a winner of an award that could total $2 million or more from @BloombergDotOrg for its efforts to address climate change and sustainability." http://bit.ly/2R79WXA

text: How is action on climate change and sustainability connected to equity and social justice here in Philadelphia? Read this Q&A with @GreenworksPhila's Sophia Sarkar  http://bit.ly/2E6GMX0 pic.twitter.com/ALFo4RBLjo

text: Philly is the cradle of liberty. We’re staying true to our innovative spirit in the 21st century, including by acting on climate change. We just joined 22 other cities reaffirming our commitment to practical reforms to help the planet: https://bit.ly/2MDymdc  #Cities4Climatepic.twitter.com/gxhxMT1X1y
text_html: Philly is the cradle of liberty. We’re staying true to our innovative spirit in the 21st century, including by acting on climate change. We just joined 22 other cities reaffirming our commitment to practical reforms to help the planet: https://bit.ly/2MDymdc  #Cities4Climatepic.twitter.com/gxhxMT1X1y

text: Did you know that Philadelphia hosts content, including info about climate change, that was removed from the EPA's website? Check it out  http://phila.gov/climatechangeisreal/ …pic.twitter.com/VP3UtmEUYm
text_html: Did you know that Philadelphia hosts content, including info about climate change, that was removed from the EPA's website? Check it out http://phila.gov/climatechangeisreal/ …pic.twitter.com/VP3UtmEUYm

text: Climate change is real. We're getting more rain and snow, and summer nights are hotter. We're preparing for climate change and committed to the Paris Agreement to reduce our carbon emissions 80% by 2050. We recently updated building codes to help us do it: http://bit.ly/2O5bEXV
text_html: Climate change is real. We're getting more rain and snow, and summer nights are hotter. We're preparing for climate change and committed to the Paris Agreement to reduce our carbon emissions 80% by 2050. We recently updated building codes to help us do it: http://bit.ly/2O5bEXV

text: Climate change is real. Philadelphia has committed to four new energy and climate goals for City-owned facilities  http://bit.ly/PhilaEMP pic.twitter.com/GCUJKTBacd
text_html: Climate change is real. Philadelphia has committed to four new energy and climate goals for City-owned facilities http://bit.ly/PhilaEMP pic.twitter.com/GCUJKTBacd

text: No matter what happens in Washington, Philadelphia is preparing for climate change and working to make our city cleaner, greener, and more equitable for all. Read our plan  http://bit.ly/PhilaEMP pic.twitter.com/WQLS609fnv
text_html: No matter what happens in Washington, Philadelphia is preparing for climate change and working to make our city cleaner, greener, and more equitable for all. Read our plan http://bit.ly/PhilaEMP pic.twitter.com/WQLS609fnv

text: Experts say that carbon emissions need to be dramatically reduced by 2030 to stave off the worst impacts of climate change. The City is taking action to help combat the climate crisis, but we can’t do it alone. Here are some ways you can help. https://www.phila.gov/2019-12-06-5-ways-you-can-help-fight-climate-change-in-philly/ …
text_html: Experts say that carbon emissions need to be dramatically reduced by 2030 to stave off the worst impacts of climate change. The City is taking action to help combat the climate crisis, but we can’t do it alone. Here are some ways you can help. https://www.phila.gov/2019-12-06-5-ways-you-can-help-fight-climate-change-in-philly/ …

text: By 2020, 22% of the electricity used in city buildings will be powered by the sun! You can do your part in our city’s fight against climate change by signing up for the Climate Collaborative of Greater Philadelphia. https://www.inquirer.com/science/climate/climate-change-collaborative-greater-philadelphia-20191016.html …
text_html: By 2020, 22% of the electricity used in city buildings will be powered by the sun! You can do your part in our city’s fight against climate change by signing up for the Climate Collaborative of Greater Philadelphia. https://www.inquirer.com/science/climate/climate-change-collaborative-greater-philadelphia-20191016.html …

text: As a leader in the fight against climate change, we want to help our local organizations with their climate goals. That’s why we launched the Climate Collaborative of Greater Philadelphia! Learn more about the new initiative  https://www.inquirer.com/science/climate/climate-change-collaborative-greater-philadelphia-20191016.html …
text_html: As a leader in the fight against climate change, we want to help our local organizations with their climate goals. That’s why we launched the Climate Collaborative of Greater Philadelphia! Learn more about the new initiative https://www.inquirer.com/science/climate/climate-change-collaborative-greater-philadelphia-20191016.html …

text: Are you ready to join us in the fight against climate change? Our Climate Collaborative of Greater Philadelphia and Zero Waste Partnership provide resources that can help your organization become more sustainable. https://www.gridphilly.com/grid-magazine/2019/10/10/two-sustainability-programs-the-city-has-launched-that-businesses-should-know-about …

text: Check out what @PhillyMayor's climate change squad has been up to at the @c40cities World Mayors Summit. #TheFutureWeWant https://www.gridphilly.com/grid-magazine/2019/10/9/day-one-of-the-cities-world-mayors-summit-in-copenhagen-part-1-of-3 …

text: Is your organization looking to step-up in the fight against climate change? Now’s the time to join the Climate Collaborative of Greater Philadelphia, a regional partnership designed to tackle the global climate emergency here in Philly. https://www.phila.gov/2019-10-04-join-the-climate-collaborative-of-greater-philadelphia/ …
